name: Staphylococcus aureus
input: Gram-positive cocci in clusters, catalase positive, coagulase positive, beta-haemolytic on blood agar. Grows at 37 °C aerobically. Ferments glucose, mannitol and sucrose but not lactose. DNase positive, VP positive, MR negative, citrate negative, oxidase negative, indole negative, urease variable. NaCl tolerant up to 7%.

name: Salmonella enterica
input: Gram-negative rods, motile, non-spore-forming. Oxidase negative, catalase positive, indole negative, urease negative. MR positive, VP negative, citrate positive. Produces H₂S, reduces nitrate. Grows at 37 °C under facultative anaerobic conditions. Ferments glucose, mannitol, xylose and arabinose but not lactose, sucrose or raffinose. ONPG negative, lysine decarboxylase positive.

name: Listeria monocytogenes
input: Gram-positive short rods, catalase positive, oxidase negative, motile at 25 °C, non-spore-forming, beta-haemolytic on blood agar, grows on ALOA. MR negative, VP positive, citrate negative. Ferments glucose, maltose, rhamnose, but not xylose. Esculin hydrolysis positive, nitrate negative.

name: Enterobacter cloacae
input: Gram-negative rod, motile, oxidase negative, catalase positive. Indole negative, citrate positive, VP positive, MR negative, urease positive, ONPG positive, nitrate reduction positive. Grows on MacConkey agar as pink colonies. Ferments glucose, lactose, sucrose and mannitol. Aerobic or facultative anaerobic.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa
input: Gram-negative rods, motile, oxidase positive, catalase positive, non-fermentative, grows on Nutrient agar and MacConkey agar forming green colonies. Produces pyocyanin. Citrate positive, MR negative, VP negative, indole negative, urease negative. Aerobic, 37 °C. Gelatin hydrolysis positive, DNase positive.

The isolate is a Gram-negative rod, motile, oxidase negative and catalase positive. It produces H2S on XLD agar and ferments glucose, mannitol and xylose but not lactose or sucrose. Colonies are small and black on XLD agar. It grows well at 37 °C under facultative conditions.
Gram-positive cocci in clusters, catalase and coagulase positive. Colonies appear golden yellow on Blood Agar with beta haemolysis. Grows aerobically at 37 °C.
Gram-negative rods, oxidase positive, non-fermenter on MacConkey Agar, motile. Produces a fruity odour and forms green pigment colonies on nutrient agar. Grows well at 42 °C.
Gram-positive rods, catalase positive and spore forming. Grows aerobically at 30 °C and 45 °C. Colonies appear dry and white on Nutrient Agar.
Gram-positive cocci in chains, catalase negative, beta haemolysis on Blood Agar. Esculin hydrolysis positive and PYR test positive. Facultative anaerobe.
Gram-positive short rods, catalase positive, non-spore forming. Grows at 4 °C but not at 45 °C. Beta haemolysis on Blood Agar and shows tumbling motility.
Gram-negative curved rods, oxidase positive, catalase positive, grows on TCBS agar forming yellow colonies. Ferments sucrose and mannitol but not lactose. Motile by polar flagella.

Gram-negative rods, oxidase negative, indole positive, citrate negative, urease positive. Ferments glucose and lactose with acid and gas production on MacConkey Agar. Non-spore forming, motile. Facultative anaerobe.
Gram-negative rods, oxidase negative, non-motile, citrate positive, urease positive. Colonies are pale pink and smooth on MacConkey Agar. Grows at 37 °C. Facultative anaerobe.
Gram-negative diplococci, oxidase positive, catalase positive, grows on Chocolate Agar and Thayer Martin Agar. Non-motile. Capnophilic growth requirement.
